description: line drawing of man seated with his legs crossed at the knee and his hands folded in his lap; he faces to the viewer's left
portfolio: From Friends of the Artist: A Suite of Seven Etchings and Lithographs
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
text: Sigmund Abeles (born 1934) is a painter, printmaker, and sculptor who has pursued his long career in New York and New England. His work is figurative and he often shows his subjects in unflinching detail and sometimes awkward poses. This portrait is part of a portfolio of seven that Barbara Swan made of artist friends who worked in New England.
title: Sigmund Abeles
